bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, January 23, 1953

div1.p: Nogueira answers questions posed by Hench in regards to the Camp Lazear dedication. He will mail Hench the films from the event.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, January 23, 1953
div1.opener:
Write re
Wood.
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
TELEFONO: B0-7577
Marianao Enero 23 de 1953
Dr Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnessota
U.S.A.
Dear Philip:
div1.p:
Greetings, and I pray you for give me the long delay in
answering the last letters; but it was really because of the Christ-
mas Hollidays, and my proffesional work, obliged me, not to have ti-
me to look after your wishes as you deserved. That's why today I re-
plying your questions and informing you others things left behind.

With respect to the unveiling it was in the following order:
1.- Dr Carlos. J. Finlay, by his son Frank Finlay.
2.- Dr Claudio Delgado by widow Mrs Carmen Alonso.
3.- Dr Leonard Wood by his daughter (you know her name).-
4.- General Walter Reed, by Embassador of the U.S. Mr William Beulac.
5.- Dr Jesse Lazear by the Mayor of Marianao, Mr Francisco Grue Gon-
zalez.
6.- Dr James Carroll, by Mr Lenner from the Embassy of the U.S.A.
7.- Dr Aristides Agramonte by his daugther Mrs Rodriguez Leon (you
know perfectly).-
8.- Volunteers' plates named Number 1, where appear Folk, Hanberry,
etc, by Johny Moran widow brother.- His name is Mr Manuel Cerea-
lles.
9.- Volunteers' second plate and those who took part, by Miss Rojas

In relation with the addres of Mr Frank Finlay is:
Mr Frank Finlay; Calle D # 54.- Vedado- Habana.- Cuba

The address of Mrs Delgado (widow) and her son Dr Abelardo Delgado
is just the same:
Paseo # 602.- Vedado.- Habana.- Cuba

With regard to Dr Delgado (son) his proper name is Abelardo, not
Alberto as appeared in your letter.- He is a lawyer or rather Doctor
on Public Rights.

DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
TELEFONO: B0-7577
Dr Philip Hench - (2).-

Under separate cover I'm mailing you the films I got that I think
are what you need.

There are some others films in the hands of Mr Laverde, cameraman
on Health Board, which in case you need any photo that is not among
these, let me know, I think I can get some to borrow and will send
you, much better if you say what copies you need and the numbers and
then I will try to get them here and mail them quickly.-

The program on the act the Park was as follows:
1.-DDr Alberto Recio.
2.- Dr Philip Hench
3.- Mr Cesar Rodriguez (inrelations your speech)
4.- Dr Pedro Nogueira (Trsnlate in spanish the speech of
General Streit).-
5.- Profesor Tocantins
6.- Dr Abelardo Delgado (Dr Delgado son).
7.- Dr Enrique Saladrigas.

Unfortunately I cant say exactly how the wreaths where placed,
why the copy I had, I gave the newspapermen on the act on the Park
and I suppose it is lost.-

In relations to the copy you ask for about my address, I wish to
know if you means on the Accademy on the night 3 December; because
on the Park I only read the words sent by General Streit, in spanish
language. Then tell me, in your next letter, which you refered to in
your letters of January 5th.-

As far as General Kean, I made no official suggestion on Finlay
Order, because he was condecorated already some years ago; but may
be next yoear, we might ask a postum promotion and possibly we will
obtain it.-

On Dr Carroll I think we are to be blamed, not to have asked a cop
decoration for his son, but the truth is, as every thing was on my
responsability on those days, I forgot all about it, but I hope,
next year, to make good what I left out, this year.

DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
TELEFONO: B0-7577
Dr Philip Hench (3).

About the souvenirs, I wish to inform you, we are in condition
to send you, what you like; and I consider they could be send to you
directly from here, for you to give them out to the persons interes-
ted in the name of the Goverment of Cuba, or on the other hand, we
can right from overhere mail them to those persons.- I wait you re-
play on this matter.

Talking with the Captain Mr Palomino, he promised to take some
airviews over the Lazear Camp at any moment; in that case I will let
you have them as soon as it is done.-

I think Philip that those answers are ask for you
in your letters.- I will write next week in relations with others
things.-
Many regards for Mary:
